dialogues.text: In my line of work, you don’t ask that question. Curiosity gets you dead. All I care is that check clears.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: How often did you meet with Axe?

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: Only once in person. Rest of time, he would use intermediaries. I don’t think he even has office in that building.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: So how do I get to him?

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: I do not know --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I_just cut off my finger.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: No one does! He’s paranoid -- doesn’t tell anyone where he’s staying in the city. Takes all his calls on an encrypted cell. If you want him, you have to draw him out. Bloodshot takes a beat. Gets an idea --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Where is the bomb?

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: He’s sitting on it in Bolshoi Port, but he leaves in morning. He has a small army guarding it -- getting in is not possible.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: You'd be surprised by what’s possible. Bloodshot takes his severed finger, winces as he pushes i against the stump... nanites stitch it back in place. Kri can barely believe his eyes.  55. BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) If you're lying to me, I’1l come back. Get a sample of your blood.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: What you have given me... it is worth more than ten mass EMPs. Bloodshot holds up the shot glass...

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: You mean this? And drinks his own blood. Krieger is heartbroken. Bloodsh scratches Viktor’s head before slipping out.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: (to the dog) Traitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot moves quickly down the street, talking to himse

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Less than a kilometer. He’s using voice over IP to speak with --

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE
dialogues.text: Harting, looking over satellite images of the Bolshoi Por Techs and the Chainsaw team work furiously behind him. A marker indicates Bloodshot’s location on a 3-D map.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING, (INTO COM)
dialogues.text: Bolshoi is a private shipping center, minimal government interference.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Good waystation for exporting really nasty black market weapons. KP analyzes surveillance photos of the port...

dialogues.speaker: KP
dialogues.text: Redundant perimeter, interior fence is electrified. Two dozen guards with dogs on a variable rotation.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Tibbs, run scenarios for point-of-entry --  56.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Already found P.O.E.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Chances of detection?

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Pretty high. Going through the front.

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: Pretty high?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two armed SECURITY GUARDS are smoking inside the gate hou when one of them notices on the monitor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot walking right up to the front gate. Both guards emerge. Note: Dialogue in italics is subtitled.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Private property, asshole. You don’t belong here.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Here to see Martin Axe.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Really? The nature of your business?

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I'm going to kill him. The guard looks back at his buddy -- is this guy for real In a flash -- Bloodshot RIPS the rifle out of the guard’s hands -- the other guard PANICS -- opens fire -- Shoots Bloodshot AND the other guard. Both bodies fall to the snow -- dead. Surviving guard’s f says it all -- fuck me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harting, Tibbs, and KP all stare at the surveillance and satellite footage. For a moment, the three of them share lock of utter shock and horror. Then, a smile spreads over KP’s face.  57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Russian copycat of an American cartoon plays on a small One lone WATCHMAN with an AK-47 sits at a desk, enjoying show with a grin. Then he stands as a group of OTHER GUAR led by a MERCENARY COMMANDER (M.C.) haul in two bodies in black body bags. M.C. takes Bloodshot’s Desert Eagle from Guards, inspects it, nods, then sets it down, ordering: M.C. Put them on the tables here. The Guards obey, then leave. Meanwhile, the M.C. goes to the Watchman’s desk and grabs handset to the freighter’s internal phone line.

dialogues.speaker: M.C., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) There’s been an incident. An intruder attempted to gain entry but Ivan shot and killed him at the gangway. The other Ivan was killed, too. Friendly fire. INT. CAPTAIN’S QUARTERS - THAT MOMENT Revealing MARTIN AXE sitting up in bed, handset to his ea He’s getting out now like this is mobilizing news.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Is he American? (beat) Are you sure he’s dead? Axe reaches out and grabs a little REMOTE, thumbing it to activate the little LED screen: “ARMED.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The M.C. listens to his orders from Axe. M.C. Stay with them? Yes sir. The M.C. hangs up and looks back at the body bags, like, the hell am I babysitting dead men? Next to him, the Watc remains standing but goes back to his cartoons. In the background, visible between these two thugs, one o the body bags begins to UNZIP ITSELF. Behind them, Bloodshot SITS UP. Looks over at the men.  58. Bloodshot picks up his Desert Eagle off the table.

dialogues.speaker: WATCHMAN
dialogues.text: This is my favorite part. You seen it diveaay? Why watch again? Don’t you want to be surprised? Bloodshot SHOOTS THEM BOTH -- double taps -- they collaps He grabs assault rifle from the M.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot makes his way down the narrow metal steps, arme with the AK-47. He ducks into the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot searches the various panels -- finds the power line, RIPS it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power goes out here but emergency lighting flickers on, revealing MARTIN AXE with a shotgun, alert as a cat after shot of espresso. His crew of MERCS are close. Four, five... at least six.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: He’s here. He’s down in the hold. (then) That means GO, you idiots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axe’s MERCS make their way into the bowels of the freight weapons ready... Flashlights sweeping... Totally unaware that in the shadows -- Bloodshot watches. His eyes are tinged with a dull crimson GLOW, tracking th with a nanite-induced infrared filter until -- He STRIKES, blasting in the dark -- all rage and brutalit gone is the wisecracking man we thought we knew -- One, two, three men go down before they know what hit the  59. But there are too many, and from the door:

dialogues.speaker: AXE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s him! Bloodshot finds Axe at the entry, a silhouette against th deck lights beyond, and Bloodshot forgets about the other MERCS around him, it’s all about getting to Axe -- Bloodshot FIRES at Axe, who ducks away -- -- And that’s when two Mercs GUN BLOODSHOT DOWN. He starts to get up again --

dialogues.speaker: MERC
dialogues.text: Sonuva-—— And they shoot him AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: MERC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What d’you think he was on? PCP? The Merc kicks at Bloodshot’s corpse. Bloodshot rolls ove handgun in his grip, and BLASTS at the Merc, dropping him The SECOND MERC freaks out, FIRES AGAIN, two to the chest

dialogues.speaker: AXE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Did you get him?

dialogues.speaker: MERC 2
dialogues.text: I think? Merc 2 is out of ammo. As he’s reloading -- Bloodshot get FOR A THIRD TIME, teeth gritted, oozing black from the co of his mouth, and SHOOTS the final Merc in the head. This man absolutely will not stop, despite the mortal pai And speaking of pain-- Bloodshot then spits up half a dozen spent bullets. AT THE DOOR, Axe peers back inside, tense...

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Is it safe? In the dark, a shadow moves for him. But this shadow’s ey glow red, as well as a RED CIRCLE in his torso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axe BURSTS into the dark kitchen -- on the run. From behi  60. BLOODSHOT’S VOICE You murdered my wife. Axe spins -- FIRES -- nothing. BLOODSHOT’S VOICE (CONT'D) Shot her in the head. Axe spins, SHOOTS again -- still nothing. Knows he's scre

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: This really about some girl? BLOODSHOT’S VOICE You don’t remember. Axe FIRES blindly -- BLOODSHOT’S VOICE (CONT’D) But I do. Muzzle FLASH reveals Bloodshot next to him. Axe LUNGES fo the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axe BURSTS on to the deck -- Bloodshot right behind him - Axe RUNS for the railing, to dive off -- A GUNSHOT to the back puts Axe on the deck, face down. Axe WAILS, then tries to crawl -- but he’s lost feeling i his legs. The shot paralyzed him. Bloodshot steps close, the Desert Eagle in his hand... An looks scarier than ever. Full of primal rage. Sneering:

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: You were casual about it. Like she didn’t matter at all. She mattered to me. Axe rolls over to face his enemy. Bloodshot is holding ou his iPod, “reminding” Axe of Gina with a photo of her. He been carrying it with him this whole time. Axe shows Bloodshot what’s in his hand: A REMOTE. BLINKIN

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Better hope you can run fast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot stares down at us along the sights of the massi Desert Eagle. He says right at our face:  61.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Thanks for the advice. BLAM! MUZZLE FLASH whites us out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the satellite feed, a HEAT BALLOON or similar light be to blossom from the cargo ship. Klaxons CHIME from the sy as Techs scramble to isolate what just happened --

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: What is that, talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: Got a power spike in the hold, something’s been triggered --

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Nuclear?

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: No. Electromagnetic.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Christ -- (into headset) Listen, you have to move now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the high railing of the freighter thirty feet up, Bloodshot LEAPS to the concrete dock -- His legs break, knees buckle, and he rolls in pain. But a moment later he gets back up, the nanites stitching broken legs together... One step, then two... then -- He’s running again -- with Harting in his ear -- HARTING’S VOICE An EMP has been triggered -- you have ten seconds to get clear!

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: What happens if I’m in it? HARTING’S VOICE Very bad things. So Bloodshot runs. Faster than ever.  62. On approach to the GATEHOUSE, he uses his momentum to LEA onto the roof of a parked car, and then to the roof of th gatehouse -- And now he’s hauling ass OVER ROOFTOPS, vaulting across alleys at 35MPH -- And then from the cargo ship a quarter-mile behind him: a distant CRACK and an abrupt BURST OF LIGHT -- Everything metal GROANS as a wave of shimmering magnetic energy BALLOONS from the belly of the cargo hold and then Lights out. Everywhere. No loud explosion. No mushroom cloud. Just a rolling blac like a ripple in a pond, rushing to Bloodshot and then --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Not good not good not good -- OVERTAKING HIM and shutting out power --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harting’s screen goes black -- his line to Bloodshot dead

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot DOUBLES OVER in pain -- ENDOSCOPIC SHOT: Bloodshot’s brain -- the nanites go dark then flicker -- a total system failure. Bloodshot’s eyes roll back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Complete ass-puckering panic --

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Give me something -- an image --

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: You got it --

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: I got black.

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: That’s it. Not a light on for two hundred square miles.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Give his face to the Russian police.  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot’s dying -- the nanites not re-booting -- his le not healing -- like nothing he’s experienced before. Bloodshot FALLS to the snowy rooftop on his back. WHUMP. His body begins to TURN GRAY... And on his torso, dead-center, a RED CIRCLE of light puls ENDOSCOPIC SHOT: Bloodshot’s brain -- nanites FLICKER in unison -- trying to reboot -- finally they go dark.

dialogues.speaker: FRANTIC VISUAL COLLAGE
dialogues.text: Day of the dead images -- coffins and carnations -- a chi in skull face paint -- Ray and Gina in the hotel room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot wakes in bed. Alone. Which seems... odd.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Gina...? He looks around -- finds the note. Went to get us breakfast, back soon. Practice makes perfe Bloodshot smiles. Turns and catches his reflection in the mirror -- the scar on his chest is gone. Or was it ever there?

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT, (V.O., PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: Sorry to call so early. Just needed to talk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot’s on the balcony, leaving a message.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Thinking about getting out of the field, taking that instructor's post... Remnants of the Day of the Dead festival litter the stree below. It’s all so... familiar.  64. BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) (laughs to himself) Sorry, if we’ve, uh, talked about this before. Just had this crazy dream.. anyway, call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot’s in the shower... lost in thought. Keeps scrub the same spot on his chest... right where the scar should Something is definitely wrong. He turns off the water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CREAK -- the door opens -- two Pros enter -- just as they before. Head towards the steam-filled bathroom, passing t

dialogues.speaker: BALCONY
dialogues.text: Where Bloodshot is clothed and ready -- SOG knife in hand In a FLASH -- he takes out the first Pro. Second Pro LUNG at Bloodshot -- who COUNTERS with ease, pinning his attac against the balcony railing.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Where is she? Where’s my wife. Bloodshot remembers -- everything. Pro curses in Spanish BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) Then I’1l ask Martin Axe. Bloodshot THROWS the Pro off the balcony before --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving into the hall, ready for Axe. But it’s empty. The stairwell door opens... here we go... But it’s just some OLD GUY with a ponytail. He sees the k in Bloodshot’s hand... freezes.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Go to your room -- lock the door. Old Guy moves quickly past Bloodshot -- but then turns an STABS Bloodshot in the back with an auto-injector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shocked Bloodshot SPINS on the old guy... legs lock up. his vision... cloudy... finally he collapses.  65.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKNESS
dialogues.text: We know what comes next -- Stairway to Heaven. Hood comes off, Bloodshot’s back in the chair --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it’s not Axe in front him -- it’s that old quy.

dialogues.speaker: OLD GUY
dialogues.text: Now this, this is torture.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Who --

dialogues.speaker: OLD GUY
dialogues.text: Led Zeppelin. Most overrated band --

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: -- are you?

dialogues.speaker: OLD GUY
dialogues.text: I think I’1l ask the questions. Bloodshot is beyond confused... What the hell is going on

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Where’s Martin... Axe?

dialogues.speaker: OLD GUY
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: He set this up... took my wife...

dialogues.speaker: OLD GUY
dialogues.text: Right about one thing... The old guy gives the signal and his MEN drag in Gina, bo gagged -- but very much alive. Bloodshot smiles, tears welling up -- emotions overwhelmi Imagine finding the person you loved the most -- and lost only to know you're about to lose them again.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Please... please don’t do this...

dialogues.speaker: OLD GUY
dialogues.text: Just need to know about Colombia --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I_ DON’T KNOW. I don’t know... why are you doing this... why?  66. Ever see someone’s soul crushed? You're watching it. Gina SOBS -- Bloodshot tries to console her... BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) I’m sorry... so sorry... He closes his eyes -- can’t look at her -- too real -- to raw. We hold on Bloodshot’s face... GUNSHOT -- Bloodshot SHUDDERS -- Gina’s SOBBING silenced. BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) (defeated) Just do it... just kill me... Bloodshot looks up -- .45 pointed right at us, just like but now it’s the old guy’s tattooed hand holding the gun.

dialogues.speaker: OLD GUY
dialogues.text: Thanks for the advice.

dialogues.speaker: GUNSHOT RIPS US BACK TO
dialogues.text: Bloodshot. His eyes flutter open... he’s groggy, restrain In the resurrection tank?

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: It wasn’t... Axe...

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: No time. Bloodshot looks around -- realizes he’s actually in -- INT. KRIEGER’S WORK ROOM - NIGHT Darkness. And the sound of a diesel generator running rig next to the bed Bloodshot’s on. Correction -- he’s cuffed to the bed. Further correction -- it’s just a metal frame + box sprin

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: Good. You're awake. A set of JUMPER CABLES lead from the generator to the bar metal of the bed. Krieger holds one free, then reaches ou and touches it to the box spring -- ELECTROCUTING Bloodshot. Bloodshot tries to pull free -- barely breathe --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Russian bastard --  67.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: You're dying.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’ve done that before --

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: Shut up -- I’m saving you. Krieger hits him again -- Bloodshot SPASMS -- ENDOSCOPIC SHOT: Bloodshot’s heart -- nanites flicker -- trying to come back online -- FLASH TO: a bald CHINESE MAN, .45 pointed right at us --

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE MAN
dialogues.text: Thanks -- BACK TO: Bloodshot -- teeth GRIND -- pain unbearable.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: It worked? No response -- Krieger SHOCKS him again. Bloodshot contor in pain -- the chest scar GLOWS RED, his skin fades WHITE FLASH TO: a GERMAN with steely blue eyes, same .45 --

dialogues.speaker: GERMAN
dialogues.text: Thanks for the -- BACK TO: Bloodshot -- eyes bulging --

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: Did it work? Bloodshot just glares --

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t understand -- nothing more I can do -- maximum voltage -- Krieger SHOCKS him again -- God, that hurts. FLASH TO: an AFRICAN with a scar on his forehead --

dialogues.speaker: AFRICAN
dialogues.text: Thanks for the advice --

dialogues.speaker: GUNSHOT RIPS US BACK TO
dialogues.text: Bloodshot -- finally BREAKS free -- FALLS to the floor.  68. His gray skin finally WARMS like a chameleon changing col back to a natural tone. The skin of someone living. But instead of attacking Krieger, he repositions somethin between his teeth...

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: It... worked?

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Yeah -- the first time. But I bit my tongue off... second and third times just hurt.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: Choosers are not beggars. Bloodshot takes in his surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: How... how did I get here?

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: I found you outside. When nanites went dark, your injuries stopped healing. EMP killed everything -- so I give you a jump. Bloodshot’s whole world is spinning...

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I saw my wife again. Like a dream... Krieger gives him a sly smile...

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: Was it nice?

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Not that kind of dream. (beat) I saw her die... but it wasn’t Axe. It was some German dude, then an African with a scar, then an old guy, white ponytail, greek letters tattooed on his hand...

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: That last one sounds like Nick Baris. “Death” tattooed on his hand. In Greek. He's real. Bloodshot loosens his grip on Krieger --

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who is he?  69.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Baris was arms dealer like Axe, offered me job last year... pay was shit so I tell him to take my number and lose it.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you just tell me?

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: Because it means the myth is real!

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: What myth? What are you talking about? Krieger goes and sits down heavily in a chair nearby. He the body language of a father who just learned his teenag daughter is pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: A contract killer, wiping out anyone who stole from RST. But the violence, the determination... This man is out for blood. Each time it is personal. A vendetta.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: (beat) You think it’s me? Krieger shrugs, but it’s clear he does. BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) I was dead last month. And before that, I'd never heard of Harting or RST.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: Then maybe you are small part in bigger picture. Here is the question for you: What do you remember? What do you know is true, without a doubt? That gives Bloodshot pause. It’s catching up to him.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: (more to himself) I wanted to kill him so badly... to make him pay... what if I was wrong? (then) I have to find out.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: EMP shut down everything -- four hundred klicks -- internet, airport, cars -- only thing working right now are trains coming in from out of town.  70.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Then I need to catch one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot limps down the street, Krieger by his side. In Bloodshot’s hand: his iPod. Bricked by the EMP. Krieger doesn’t notice the look of loss on his face.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: When you get to Moscow, power will be working -- find an internet café.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I don’t need an internet café. I have wifi in my veins.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: That wifi? You always connect to RST server first. You are behind their firewall. So they can monitor your Internet activity. I would not trust that.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: How do you know so much about RST?

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: They have reputation. I have seen them take away everything from other tech designers. Discredit their name, make it impossible to return to their family, put them on global terrorist list, all to keep secrets for RST. They own you. If they can’t own you, they banish you. And if that is too much work they simply kill you. They are, to use American slang, “bags of douche.”

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Close but not quite. (a breath) Guess I’m on my own now.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: No. You are never alone. You have entire army at your command. Millions of little soldiers inside you, awaiting orders. If I give you any advice it is: Get creative.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: (nods ) Thank you. When I figure this all out, I may call on you again, for help. (earnest) And I’'1l get you that blood sample.  71.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: (smiles) You are thinking I did not take one, when you were unconscious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This station is not much more than a platform and an outd train schedule on a wall. Bloodshot waits for the next train, hands in his pockets. looks down the track: A train approaches. But it doesn’t seem to be slowing dow At the other end of the platform, a RUSSIAN PATROLMAN ste on. Walking cautiously toward Bloodshot. Bloodshot casually turns his back to the cop and keeps hi collar up, but then he sees ANOTHER PATROLMAN flanking hi

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: (sotto; sarcastic) Looks like this is my train. Except this one isn’t stopping. It rockets past him... The two PATROLMEN advance on Bloodshot, their radio hands squawking in some Russian dialect... Bloodshot gets closer to the train, like he’s ready to ju the track soon as it’s cleared the way -- The PATROLMEN pull their guns:

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN PATROLMAN 1
dialogues.text: (translated) You there! Hands up! Bloodshot obeys. Hands up. At the final car, Bloodshot reaches out and -- holy shit going to -- YANK! Bloodshot is pulled off his feet, gone an instant -- -- now dangling like a flag on the end of the train, with severely dislocated arm. With effort, he gets to the back door and steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot sits down and takes a few breaths before he physically SNAPS his dislocated arm back into place.  72. It’s audibly painful. For a moment he just lies there. Then, through the windows of this car: the street lights crossing bridge. He’s out of the EMP's range.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: (to himself) Back on the grid. Here we go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harting is pacing like a caged animal until suddenly --

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: We've got him -- BLOODSHOT’S VOICE (THROUGH COM) I’m not sure Axe killed my wife...

dialogues.speaker: HARTING, (INTO COM)
dialogues.text: You’re not “sure?”

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE
dialogues.text: Bloodshot moves for a passenger car as he speaks to Harti

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: After the blackout, I remembered it all... I was living it again, like a dream. But it wasn’t Axe, it was someone else. Harting mutes his mic, turns to a tech --

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Remote shutdown?

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: EMP re-set the protocol... not recognizing our server. Harting is not happy. Un-mutes his mic --

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: You need to come in.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I need to figure this out first.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Because you had a bad dream? The EMP shut down the nanites -- they’re malfunctioning.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Maybe they were malfunctioning before.  73.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Listen, I risked everything to give you this. And you promised me you'd return. We have no idea how badly the nanites were damaged by the mass EMP. Your whole body could shut down -- you could die.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Wouldn't be the first time...

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: You need to come back. Trust me, you don’t want to suffer PTSD with the help of a supercomputer in your brain.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: (as he enters a passenger car) Right now, I don’t trust anyone.

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: He terminated the line. Then, on screen: An organizational CHART of RST maximizes showcases the various branches of the company, with Harti name at the top -- the head of the snake.

dialogues.speaker: TECH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sir? He’s accessing our internal server now. Shall I disconnect? Harting watches. Folds his arms over his chest.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: What’s he pulling up? BLOODSHOT POV: The org chart hangs in front of us like an overlay to the real world.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (to himself) Yeah, I bet you can see this, Harting. If you've betrayed me, I’m tearing it all down... hang on, what’s this? An arrow icon in the corner connects Harting’s CEO box to something off-screen. Bloodshot triggers the icon -- And the org chart ZOOMS OUT to reveal RST is merely one branch on a massive tree of black-tech companies. A terri conglomerate of death with a dozen more men like Harting. the top of it all? A man named KOZOL. The puppet master. BLOODSHOT (0.S.) (CONT’D) Who the hell is that?  74. And from a corporate headshot of Kozol by his name --

dialogues.speaker: KOZOL, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: Just turn him off.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE
dialogues.text: Harting’s on a video conference with Kozol.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: The mass EMP re-booted the system -- it’s not recognizing the RST server commands.

dialogues.speaker: KOZOL
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Our own security system is locking us out. We're trying some other options, but we may not have any remote control.

dialogues.speaker: KOZOL
dialogues.text: If we lose him... can you make another?

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Not without him. I need more data.

dialogues.speaker: KOZOL
dialogues.text: St. Petersburg is a complete disaster --

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Which can’t be tied to us.

dialogues.speaker: KOZOL
dialogues.text: Why was he in the vicinity of that weapon?

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: We didn’t know about it in time.

dialogues.speaker: KOZOL
dialogues.text: What do you know, Doctor? Harting bites his tongue. Doesn’t like having his nose ru in his mess.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: I know I‘'1l bring him in.

dialogues.speaker: KOZOL
dialogues.text: That’s your only option, doctor. Kozol disconnects the line.  75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passenger train slices through the hilly forest, havi escaped the cold snows of deep Russia. INT. PASSENGER TRAIN - “COACH” SEATING - DAY Bloodshot makes his way up the aisle, looking for a place sit, trying to look inconspicuous. Of course he’s wearing the same shirt from St. Petersburg He looks like a hobo. A zombie hobo, with his skin tone. On the train’s TV in the corner, live news of the EMP explosion is the main attraction. A few blue-collar COMMU watch the TV with interest. Then an image of Bloodshot appears on screen, with the bu text of “BREAKING NEWS” underneath. So Bloodshot keeps moving, head down, not making eye contact with anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot slides open the door and steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where the rich ride. One extra-large seat on eith side of the main aisle versus two small ones. Leg room. And also virtually empty. In one seat: A foppish BRITISH COMMUTER, sipping a tea wh working on his laptop on a tray. Bloodshot eyes that laptop. And sits down across from him The Brit glances at Bloodshot, then does a double-take. As Bloodshot gets comfortable, the Brit clears his throat

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH COMMUTER
dialogues.text: Pardon, do you have a ticket?

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Why, is this seat taken?

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH COMMUTER
dialogues.text: I don’t think you belong here.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Everyone keeps telling me that. The Brit starts to stand up, grabbing his laptop --  76.

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH COMMUTER
dialogues.text: I’ll have the conductor tell you, so you can go back to your hillbilly convention -- Bloodshot puts a hand on his shoulder and forcibly sits h back down.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I just need to borrow your laptop.

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH COMMUTER
dialogues.text: For what? A seat warmer? Bloodshot takes the computer from the Brit’s hands and op it to discover a login screen.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I‘1l just take a minute, I won’t even close your browser so you can keep shopping for monocles or whatever --

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH COMMUTER
dialogues.text: It’s password protected.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Is it? The password sequence CYCLES THROUGH numbers until -- DIN

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH COMMUTER
dialogues.text: How did you -- The screen now displays a web browser; some gateway page paid porn site -- “Big Busted Brits!”

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Ohh wait, that’s not a monocle site! Red-faced, the Brit now jumps out of his seat and flees f the next car, with the threat over his shoulder:

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH COMMUTER
dialogues.text: The authorities will deal with this!

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: (friendly) Oh I think you’re safe to watch porn here, don’t worry! Even more incensed, the Brit opens the (electric) pocket and hurries to the next car. Now temporarily alone, Bloodshot opens a new search scree  77. Types in the name: “Nick Baris.” The browser responds with a PINWHEEL ICON. Bloodshot rolls his eyes. Taps the tray-table impatiently ON SCREEN: Search results return. News articles. Click -- SERIES OF QUICK CUTS: Photos of Baris. Tommy Lao. Freidri Leipzig. All of them from Bloodshot’s memory. A couple of bars of Led Zeppelin punch through like a broken record. GUNSHOT RIPS US BACK TO: Bloodshot, in shock. His own pas in doubt. More than that, this is a man who suddenly does know quite who he really is. Slowly, carefully, and full of hopes and fears, Bloodshot enters a new name into the search bar -- “Gina Garrison.” He hits ENTER. Nail-biting seconds go by. Bloodshot stares at the screen. Finally, the results. And the top result leads to a Faceb personal page... Gina Garrison Relationship Status not listed Currently Living in Florence, Italy Bloodshot stares at that entry. And then down to the location. Florence. The sound of the train slowing down gets his attention. Bloodshot looks up and out the window -- they’re pulling an urban train station. The foppish Brit is on his way back with a TRAIN OFFICER Bloodshot points at the pocket door just as the Officer g to it, and the door BUZZES when the Officer pulls. It’s stuck. The Officer tries again. Still stuck. Bloodshot gets up and waves at the Brit, pointing at his laptop as he heads to the other door: BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) All good, thanks!  78. He steps out of the car and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot strides from the train to the sound of an on-bo ALARM. As he looks up at the departures board, it’s in German, but-- BLOODSHOT’S POV: The German translates real-time to Engli One entry highlights: FLORENCE. And the tag: “DELAYED.”

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: (sotto) Trains are supposed to run on time here, come on Germany...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harting enters like he’s out for blood. Snaps at a TECH:

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Have we heard back from him?

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: Negative.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Hail him. Right now. The room listens via the speaker system to a quick series CHIMES, reaching out to Bloodshot. BLOODSHOT’S VOICE (over Comms ) Harting --

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Talk to me, what-- BLOODSHOT’S VOICE I’m not really in right now, still trying to figure some things out. Just give me a little time and leave a message. A long TONE over the speakers, as Harting seethes quietly

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: Went to voicemail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a window for a fashionable clothing store, a mannequin sports a stylish yet masculine OUTFIT, with a longcoat. Bloodshot admires it. Checks his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot steps up to the cash machine. He puts his hand on the number pad and squints. The screen changes to read: “TEST MODE.” And then: “TESTING DISPENSER.” Euro bills start coughing out at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot walks out of the store in new clothes. The mannequin is now nude in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleek Tesla sport model is parked in the charging stati outside the train terminal. Bloodshot steps up to the door. He snaps his fingers. And lights wink. The doors unlock. Bloodshot grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The electric sedan RIPS PAST US at 120MPH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harting debriefs Chainsaw Gang via video conference --

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Our dog is off his leash. Soon as he does a little homework, he’s going to Florence.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE
dialogues.text: KP looks uneasy...

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: What’s the play?  80.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Bring him back. In pieces, if you have to.

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: Gonna be hard with that healing factor --

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: That EMP scrambled his system. Any of his higher functions will be inactive. He’s not as tough as he was.

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: And if he gets to her before we do? Harting considers the question... point of no return.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Then she’s a liability. Harting signs off. Tibbs glances at KP -- from the look o her face, it’s not clear if she agrees.

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: There a problem soldier?

dialogues.speaker: KP
dialogues.text: No, sir. So Long smiles from ear to ear --

dialogues.speaker: SO LONG
dialogues.text: Saddle up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing. The nexus of international intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY DIRECTOR CARVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (pre-lap) Let’s get moving. INT. “STAR CHAMBER” CONFERENCE ROOM This room is designed for secret meetings. Kozol stands before a room of SEATED CIA DIRECTORS, all past their 40s white men in expensive suits and cheap morals.

dialogues.speaker: KOZOL
dialogues.text: Project Bloodshot is nearly ready for delivery. You'll get your prototype soon.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR WILLIAMSON
dialogues.text: How do we know you aren’t already using it for your own purposes?  81. The most heavyset of the Directors (BURKE) rolls his eyes finally leans in, holding a file folder:

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF DIRECTOR BURKE
dialogues.text: We know that answer already. Burke lays down SURVEILLANCE PHOTOS from the folder, arra so Kozol can see them all: They show Bolshoi Port in the wake of the EMP burst. The carnage on the deck of the cargo ship. And finally: Blood lying on the roof, red circular scar aglow as he fades ou CHIEF DIRECTOR BURKE (CONT’D) And you've been taking him for joy rides. Killing off the competition.

dialogues.speaker: KOZOL
dialogues.text: It's called “field testing.”

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF DIRECTOR BURKE
dialogues.text: This sort of exposure is what we don’t want. It was part of the deal, you know, when we gave you four point two billion dollars to go make this happen.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY DIRECTOR CARVER
dialogues.text: And now it’s worse than that -- you’ve lost him. This is not like crashing a stealth bomber in Beijing. Bloodshot is a game- changer. This gets to the wrong people, I don’t care what the joint chiefs think we need you for, you’re done. This kind of screw-up, you'll rot in Gitmo.

dialogues.speaker: KOZOL
dialogues.text: Deputy director, take a breath. I know you’re concerned about a killing machine so advanced it’s been able to slip across the protected borders of seven countries and murder men with round-the-clock security. You should be concerned. Kozol pours a glass of water from the carafe at the table And the CIA men start sweating. This isn't going well...

dialogues.speaker: KOZOL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But rest assured, Rising Spirit is very efficient. We work clean. No loose ends, no loose lips. Nationality doesn’t matter to us; every target is equal. So keep calm, no sudden moves, and if you’re lucky, when you do encounter Project Bloodshot, it won’t be in your house, alone, in the dead of night.  82. Kozol sets the water in front of them and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home of the Renaissance... rebirth. A maze of narrow stre and red rooftops along the winding Arno river. Bloodshot stands outside an electronics store full of cheap gadgets holding a prepaid phone. The electric sedan is crash-park behind him.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: (into phone) Listen carefully. You were right. And you helped me, which now makes you a target. You can go underground, wait it out, or you can help me expose Rising Spirit. INT. KRIEGER’S FLAT - DAY Krieger holds his phone to his ear with one hand as he co something over the stove, stirring it with his other. He’ also wearing safety goggles and a lead apron.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: Bloodshot, you one sweet talker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. A quaint, romantic little residential street of compact apartment buildings. Bloodshot walks up to the call box on the old seminary tu luxury condo complex... finds the button for 4D. Pauses. Then stops. Like he’s lost his courage for a moment. He then hears a car door slam SHUT somewhere nearby, so h follows an alleyway around, to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small open space behind the condo where a handful of li foreign two-seaters are parked... .»+-and a very recognizable PICKUP TRUCK. A little more b up, but otherwise it’s the one from Bloodshot’s memory. Astonished, Bloodshot approaches it. He reaches out, cautious, and places his hand on the tailgate. Caresses i as if it were a wild creature easily spooked.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: It’s real...  83. That’s what he’s grappling with -- the memories of Gina i Tijuana must have some truth, if the truck is real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot ascends the stairs, marching to 4D. At the door, he holds up a fist to knock, notices his han trembling. He is legitimately nervous about this part; bo thrilled and terrified to see his wife. While he holds his fist, trying to steady himself -- The door opens, and he is nearly run into by: GINA. Alive and well. She stops an inch short of running into him, and GASPS. Bloodshot’s heart POUNDS. Can't speak. Can't breathe. Can believe what he's seeing... And neither can she.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Gina?

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: ..-Ray? They stare at each other in shock... in wonder... But it’s also like an old, deep wound starts bleeding aga Either of them may cry at any moment --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: You’re, uh... you’re late. He says it to try and break the incredible tension, but i just brings all the sorrow roiling up even more. Gina doesn't reply with her retort. Instead she reaches o and brushes his cheek with her hand, mystified...

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: You’re real...

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Yeah --

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: I thought you were dead.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I think I was.  84. That’s all they can take. Gina steps in for an embrace. T two hold onto each other at the threshold of her door. INT. GINA’S FLORENCE APARTMENT - DAY Bloodshot sits on the sofa, a glass of water in front of Gina stares at him from a chair. Eyes still ready to cry.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: You’re-- it’s like looking at a ghost. I feel like if I blink, you’ll be gone.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I have so much to say, I don’t know where to start. I thought you were dead, too.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Me? What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I saw it. I was right there.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: In Mexico. Our second honeymoon. Gina frowns. Leans in.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: But. We never went back to Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I’m talking about when we drove to TJ... after Colombia. FLASH ON: the Chevy racing down the highway, water gliste on both sides of the road... too beautiful to be real. Gina searches his eyes... does he really not know?

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Ray... You didn’t come back from Colombia. FLASH ON: Garrison in the jeep riding with the Guerrilla. the moment we met him. Everything we’ve seen about his li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot’s whole world is spinning. Everything he knows. Everything he remembers...

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: So... None of it was real?  85. Gina comes over to where he’s sitting and puts her hands his, forcing him to focus on her:

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Hey. I was left a widow. It was real enough. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: But how... Were... were we even married?

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Don’t you remember? The little church by the beach? The pastor kept calling you ‘Gray’? My uncle fell asleep at the table? Bloodshot blinks. God, he wants those memories so badly..

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I don’t remember that. (grasping for anything) But, but I do remember you like tequila... We were somewhere near a beach--

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: You're the one who likes tequila. Not me. Gina starts to realize just how scrambled his brain is.

dialogues.speaker: GINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ray... What did they do to you?

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Brought me back from the dead. And then gave me a mission. But now, I’m done with that -- I found you. Maybe, if I’m close to you it will all start to click again --

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Hang on, wait --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: We can have a new life together somewhere --

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (struggling) I... I don’t know if I can do this again. It’s too much. Losing you nearly killed me, I cried for a year --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: A year? What are you talking about? Gina looks at him. Finally she’s starting to understand w a lost puppy he is inside that amazing fighting machine.  86.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Ray... You died five years ago. Bloodshot blinks. Hit in the gut. The room starts spinnin him. Heart racing. He doesn’t know how to respond to that But something distracts him, a small noise unheard by Gin ENDOSCOPIC SHOT: The nanites in his inner ear form conica AMPLIFIERS to zero in on the sounds -- BLOODSHOT hears it clearly now, a familiar voice just out the apartment:

dialogues.speaker: SO LONG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: In position. In a FLASH -- Bloodshot’s on his feet --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: We have to move. But it’s already in motion -- GAS GRENADES crash through windows, spewing a chemical fog -- And with a thunderous BOOM, the front door is blown off i hinges with surgical explosives -- Bloodshot grabs a shell-shocked Gina and pulls her to the bedroom -- As they go, TIBBS rappels in from the window, gas mask ov his face, assault rifle out, his feet slide on the floor And Bloodshot DAZES him with a strike, then steals his ri just as KP and SO LONG storm in from the front -- Bloodshot fires off a quick suppressive burst and then ge into the bedroom -- INT. GINA’S BEDROOM Gina has her hands over her ears, terrified by the loudne of everything -- Bloodshot points --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Get in there! Gina hurries into the master bathroom.  87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tibbs has his backup SMG in his hands, and the other two flank the bedroom door --

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: Wait. Tibbs’ eye switches over to thermographic in a CLICK -- He sees Bloodshot’s heat signature shows his location on other side of the wall. Raises his SMG, and -- Bloodshot STEPS ASIDE just as Tibbs fires. What the--? Tibbs aims and fires again -- And Bloodshot DUCKS out of the way. The hell? INT. GINA’S BEDROOM Bloodshot raises his weapon at the wall on this side, aim back at Tibbs -- BLOODSHOT’S POV: He’s using the same thermographic imager see where Tibbs is standing, and when he returns fire -- TIBBS MOVES too. But not nearly as fast. He gets clipped the shoulder with a grazing wound.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I wasn’t aiming for your head either!

dialogues.speaker: SO LONG
dialogues.text: Screw this. I’m tired of waiting. INT. GINA’S BEDROOM Bloodshot rushes into the bathroom and a moment later -- The three members of Chainsaw approach the bathroom door caution, when Tibbs signals for them to hold.

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: Harting: She’s with him. HARTING’S VOICE Then bring her in, same as him. INT. GINA’S BATHROOM Bloodshot grabs Gina and moves her to the window.  88. Peeking out the open window, it’s big enough for them bot fit through, but --

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: It’s too far down! Yeah, just a slanted red-tile roof off into god knows wha

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Do you still trust me?

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Oh hell, this is gonna hurt... He holds out his hands, his back to the open window, one perched on the frame -- starts breathing short breaths as to psych himself up for what he’s about to do --

dialogues.speaker: SO LONG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Allow me -- So Long KICKS down the door with his cybernetic leg -- And Bloodshot falls backward right out the window with Gi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fall one story onto the hard red tile -- Bloodshot cradling Gina against him protectively as they slide hard right off the slanted roof -- For a two-story FREEFALL -- CRASHING down through the fabric-awning roof of a FOOD CA Gina rolls off, harmlessly landing on all fours next to t mutilated cart with Bloodshot atop it, a mass of broken limbs, neck, ribs. Gina sees and gasps. She gasps again when Bloodshot STANDS UP.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Oh my god, Ray --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Give me a minute.  89. He cracks his head back into place. Resets his ribs. Rota his shoulders. Everything seemingly in order -- But she’s staring at him in horror. One hand over her mou the other pointed right at him, at...

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Your, your fingers are -- Whoops. The fingers of his left hand are still terribly askew, wrenched in all directions. Bloodshot slaps it against his leg, and they click back i their joints in the proper direction.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: All good. I’1l walk it off. INT. GINA’S BEDROOM So Long stares out the window, getting angrier.

dialogues.speaker: SO LONG
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: They’re mobile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harting watches. Pissed.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Chainsaw, I’ve invested half a billion dollars in you. ACT LIKE IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot’s at the wheel...

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: This is... so messed up, Ray. Who are they?

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: They’re bad people, Gina. Everything they touch turns bad.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: They were trying to kill us both back there! In my apartment! Who does that?  90.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: That was my fault. It was wrong of me to track you down like this. Let me deal with them and we can start over.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: I buried you once already. I can’t go through that again. From a side street: a black SUV in pursuit. Several block back and gaining. Bloodshot takes a corner and brakes. He faces Gina:

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I will come back for you.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (both scared and hopeful) Will you?

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Wish me luck. She can do that. Gina pulls him to her... ...and kisses him as if she’d been waiting years for it.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: That’s the best I can do. Bloodshot blinks, then grabs her for another kiss, this t a little deeper... They pull away. And some internal switch has flipped deep inside Bloodshot. Like despite all the false memories, he knows what’s real: The love they had.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KP guns the SUV around the corner, wheels skidding -- And the pickup is out of view, but instead they see: BLOODSHOT -- RUNNING RIGHT AT THEM.

dialogues.speaker: SO LONG
dialogues.text: Run him down. KP GUNS it -- Tibbs opens fire -- through the windshield glass SHATTERS -- PEDESTRIANS SCREAM --  gl. Bloodshot -- takes a BULLET -- than another -- keeps RUNNING -- SUV coming right at him -- and then he JUMPS - VAULTING RIGHT THROUGH the SUV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windshield caves in on them as Bloodshot’s momentum k launching him into the backseat -- a stray fist PUNCHING So Long as he goes by -- then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Bloodshot comes CRASHING out the rear window, a mess o man full of cut glass and broken limbs... He rolls on the ground to a heap a dozen yards away. And then... Bloodshot GETS BACK UP. And shakes it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KP shoves the windshield out -- puts it in reverse -- Tib SPINS around with his rifle -- pointed right at So Long -

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: Duck -- He hits the deck -- Tibbs FIRES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot -- takes a bullet -- another -- stumbles -- The SUV SLAMS into him again, running him down -- KP mashes the brakes and everyone stares out the front at BLOODSHOT, who despite both hit-and-run encounters... gets back up. Paler than before. Arm definitely broken -- Oh wait, he just shook it back into place. So Long grins and steps out.

dialogues.speaker: SO LONG
dialogues.text: I’ll take it from here. So Long UNLOADS his assault rifle into Bloodshot -- stepp for him as he does, “walking” his fire -- Bloodshot, taking multiple hits in the chest and legs -- falls again -- and this time he’s not getting up. Among the screams of bystanders, a distant roaring engine  92. So Long steps for Bloodshot, taunting: SO LONG (CONT’D) Good news is, you won’t remember any of this. You won’t know to be pissed at me for filling you full of holes. You won’t even know that hot wife is alive. (off Bloodshot’s reaction) That hits you hard, don’t it -- -- and then So Long is SMASHED by a collision from Gina's truck, rammed right at him. He’s thrown a dozen yards awa Gina piles out and rushes to Bloodshot’s side, kneeling d Bloodshot is bleeding black everywhere. And now he’s gone from white to grey. THE BLOOD occasionally flickers with tendrils of bio-elec energy. A tiny, liquid thunderstorm. They start to short And then that RED CIRCLE pulses through his shirt. Warnin His eyes drift in and out of focus.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Ray, don’t do this again --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: (rough whisper) Get out of here... Before... Bloodshot's gaze drifts off to a distant stare and he sto breathing. He's dead. Gina folds over his body, shoulders lurching in fresh gri And then KP steps up, weapon out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Long gets back up and joins KP. But he picks Gina up roughly to carry her to the SUV... And Gina just keeps reaching out for Bloodshot. Devastate FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot’s mangled corpse is loaded into the tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harting and Tibbs watch.  93.

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: Think you can bring him back?

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Only one way to find out. He signals to a Tech --

dialogues.speaker: HARTING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Cantonese, subtitled) Begin transfusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The circular needle array moves into place... thousands o little daggers gleaming in the light. With a sudden JERK they SLAM into Bloodshot’s chest -- CRACKING his sternum. Dark fluid is pumped down the needle array... flowing int Bloodshot’s body. Slowly his wounds begin to heal -- bone and flesh reformi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tibbs can hardly believe his prosthetic eyes...

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: You sure these are working?

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: (Cantonese, subtitled) Initiate sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Bloodshot’s lifeless face -- CUT TO: STROBING LIGHT. Sun blasts between overhead vegetation as drive quickly through --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like before. They hit a bump, Garrison eyes the rebe with the AK-47...

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Mind pointing that somewhere else? Rather not die by pothole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harting watches the real-time CT scan...  94.

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: You planting a new target?

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Time for enemy number one. Toyo Harada.

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: You think our boy’s ready?

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: No. But Kozol made the call. So by this time tomorrow, our man will think Harada murdered him and his wife while they were in Mexico. Harting checks another monitor: sequence 12% complete.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Speaking of... should be crossing the border about now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chevy RACES down the highway, water glistening as the sets, too beautiful to be real... because it's not.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: We had our honeymoon in Mexico... so, it’s not that bad. Gina pulls her hair up... she’s so beautiful. So alive. O Garrison's face -- FLASH TO: Gina at her apartment in Florence -- her hair shorter and darker. BACK TO: Garrison... lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: GINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, you here with me -- or somewhere else?

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Your hair... was it shorter?

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: When I was in like, high school. Garrison tries to shake it off.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Had this image of you... with shorter hair.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Must be thinking about your other wife...  95. He forces a smile. She takes his hand....

dialogues.speaker: GINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m just happy you're back...

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: (loaded) Yeah. Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tibbs speaks in hushed tones with Harting... So Long just ear shot.

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: What do you wanna do about the wife?

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: She stays. She’s insurance.

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: Insurance for what?

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: In case the memory implants don’t work on our boy, and he needs a fresh reminder. So Long looks to Tibbs to make sure he gets Harting’s mea and makes a gun with his fingers -- kill her? Tibbs nods: Yeah, he means kill her. So Long shoots a look across the room at:

dialogues.speaker: SO LONG
dialogues.text: KP... not sure she’s on board, boss.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: She'll get on board, or she’ll be back on a ventilator at Walter Reed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street below is quiet. Gina lies in Garrison's arms.. they’re both somewhere between dreaming and awake.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Who do you think our kid would look like? Garrison smiles, but then it fades. He finds himself sayi

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: I got a few more years of the work in me.  96. Gina’s smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: I know. I’m not pushing you.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: I just can’t be both. Off Garrison's face -- FLASH TO: Gina staring right at us in Florence with the bombshell news...

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: It's been five years. BACK TO: Garrison waking up in TJ -- uneasy. Waking Gina

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: It isn’t real.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: This.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Hey. Take a breath. Garrison's agitated. Upset. Is he losing his mind?

dialogues.speaker: GINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You had a bad dream, that’s all. Gina takes his hand, tempts him back into bed... all he w is to be with her... so he gives in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harting’s staring at one of the monitors, observing the resurrection process, while Tibbs escorts a nervous-as-he Gina into the control room.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: His CT deviated... but now it’s back. There’s always some variation. Gina sees Ray in the tank on the monitor. It’s heartbreak

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: What did you do to him...?  97.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Saved his life. Ray Garrison was a capable soldier, proficient in close quarters combat, small arms, and heavy ordinance. But the deadliest weapon in his whole arsenal? The one he’s used to kill with astonishing success? (off her look) You. His love for you.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (aghast) What? Harting keys a sequence and several PROFILES appear on th monitors before them. We recognize them: Bloodshot’s form targets. Axe, Baris, the German, etc. And one new face we learn is TOYO HARADA.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: These men were notorious criminals. And no one could get to them. Not until your husband. Not until he believed he was avenging your death. (right at Gina) Isn't that incredible? She stares at him in shock. He’s being genuine -- Harting truly is impressed by this, and assumes she will, too.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: You turned him into a monster. Harting’s proud smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: You’re staring at a literal death-defying invention and you choose to respond with insults? Do you know how much was sacrificed to build what you see here? But Gina goes cold, answering:

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Yes. His whole future. A TECHNICIAN interrupts the moment by bringing Harting a small BOX containing three metal ORB-like devices.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: These are from R&D? The Tech nods. Harting holds one in his hand, proud.  98.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: My contingency plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hood comes off -- Led Zeppelin BLASTING. In front of Garr is that high-value target pictured on Harting’s view scre TOYO HARADA, 40s, dressed in a sharp suit. Garrison's groggy... confused... Deja Vu overwhelming...

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Zeppelin. Always Zeppelin.

dialogues.speaker: HARADA
dialogues.text: I’m not here to talk music --

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: You’re going to ask me about Colombia, right? That’s why I remember the mission, so this will feel real...

dialogues.speaker: HARADA
dialogues.text: Oh, this is very real. Harada signals his men -- they drag in Gina -- bound and gagged. Off Garrison’s face -- FLASH TO: the real Gina kissing him in the truck... That unforgettable goodbye kiss.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Garrison -- it all snaps into place -- none of this is re

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Go ahead -- shoot her. Harada almost drops his .45... wasn’t expecting that. GARRISON (CONT’D) You’re going to do it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: HARADA
dialogues.text: Not if you tell me what I want to know. A terrified Gina looks to Garrison... why are you doing t And he looks back at her, his heart breaking all over aga  99.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Nothing I say or do will matter. It’s too late... I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: HARADA
dialogues.text: Me, too. GUNSHOT -- Gina’s head snaps back -- blood splatters -- Garrison hyperventilates -- looks pretty damn real.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: bo IT. Garrison braces for what he knows is coming next-- GARRISON (CONT’D) JUST FUCKING DO IT. Harada points his .45 at Garrison...

dialogues.speaker: HARADA
dialogues.text: Thanks for the advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot wakes with a start... a twinkle in his eye. He knows exactly where he is. HARTING’S VOICE Language centers online. (in English) Identify yourself. Bloodshot thrashes violently -- skin pale as a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I don’t know -- (enraged) WHY DON’T I KNOW?!? HARTING’S VOICE Begin sedation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot sits up suddenly. Tries to get his bearings. Notices all the security cameras pointed at him. He opens his shirt to see the telltale red circle as it f to reveal the scar. He touches it, as if trying to remember where he got it.  100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harting turns to one of the techs...

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: What sport should I go with this time? Tennis or Cricket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot looks up as Harting enters...

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: How are you feeling? Harting steps closer... Bloodshot blinks, groggy. He tend touches his head as if it were throbbing from a bender.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Hell of a hangover.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: So you remember what a hangover feels like?

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, yes.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: That’s good... Harting watches Bloodshot for a long moment, studying him Then, when Harting reaches to check his vitals --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: That’s not all I remember -- Bloodshot LUNGES at Harting -- who SPINS towards the exit

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: EMERGENCY PROTOCOL --— Bloodshot closes -- fast -- but Harting makes it out firs SLAMS the door -- Bloodshot RAILS against the glass panel

dialogues.speaker: HARTING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where’s the gas?!? Suddenly the room fills with a chemical fog -- Bloodshot starts to lose consciousness... with his last ounce of strength he hits the glass one final time -- And it SHATTERS. Air rushes in as the gas seeps out -- Harting covers his face --  101.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Seal the room -- Techs and security retreat out of the lab... leaving Bloodshot all alone. Staring out at something we can’t see, he vocalizes a com to the nanites --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Show me security camera feed. BLOODSHOT POV: An overlay appears, showing various securi cameras of the facility. Several persons of interest are visually ‘tagged’ when spotted on cameras, like Harting, So Long, Tibbs... And then one camera reveals GINA, pacing in a locked room Bloodshot blinks. BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) Gina. Bloodshot gets up and goes for a camera in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tibbs meets Harting as he enters --

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: I’m not sure... ON THE MONITOR: Bloodshot breaks a light -- crosses the wires -- then BLACKNESS. Tibbs sees this, and it’s all he needs to get moving:

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS, (INTO COM)
dialogues.text: Chainsaw -- Bloodshot is escaping. Block off all exits -- Harting snaps his fingers when he catches sight of Bloods (via security cameras) rushing deeper into the facility.. Right past the stairwell door marked “EXIT.”

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: No. He’s not escaping. He’s going deeper into the lab.  102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot sees the elevator rising to his floor -- BLOODSHOT POV: And on one of the security camera windows his mind’s eye, the elevator is packed with a SECURITY TE in full armor, assault rifles, and grenades. DING! The elevator doors slide open -- a SOLDIER steps ou the lead with a ballistic shield, leading the rest -- -- and Bloodshot strikes from above, having clung to the ceiling overhead -- punching and kicking while they’re al bunched up and too close to fire -- Some get a few bursts off but the rounds chew right throu Bloodshot and wind up killing TEAMMATES behind him until Boom, the last goes down. Bloodshot’s surrounded by bodie But now there are sounds of the Chainsaw gang approaching from the stairwell. Only one way to get past: the infusion lab. Bloodshot put grenade to the lab doors on the handle and pulls the pin. He then looks around for somewhere to find cover -- oh sh there’s nowhere to hide really --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Ah hell -- He grabs the ballistic shield and crouches behind it, the BLOWN BACK when the grenade detonates in a fiery explosio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire and smoke and alarms. But where is -- oh here he com Bloodshot walks through the wall of flames... emerging on other side ON FIRE, like some demon stepping out of hell. ...-but then the nanites are so good at healing him, the actually snuffs out as he strides for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A faint ringing CHIRP from Bloodshot’s head, then:

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Tell me you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting in a white, unmarked van outside -- none other th that crazy Russian ALEXI KRIEGER. Into his phone:  103.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: Waiting outside. Parking is terrible. You on your way down?

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Not yet. With that, Bloodshot is on the move again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chainsaw emerges from the freight elevator...

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS, (INTO COM)
dialogues.text: Place is on fire, Doc. He won’t last long. HARTING’S VOICE (THROUGH COM) If he destroys more property in there, neither will you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot’s surrounded by flames... but he’s nonplussed, kicking at the exit doors, breaking the lock. Suddenly -- GUNSHOT. His shoulder explodes with inky blac blood. Direct hit from:

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: Near the entrance -- smoke obscuring his view -- TIBBS’S POV: Bloodshot’s thermal image is clearly visible Trigger squeeze -- BULLET POV -- ROCKET towards --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Nearly takes another hit. He closes his eyes -- exhales - ENDOSCOPIC SHOT: Bloodshot’s heart -- nanites slow the bl flow so that his body cools and -- TIBBS’S POV: Bloodshot’s thermal image disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tibbs turns to KP and So Long --

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: We're going in.

dialogues.speaker: SO LONG
dialogues.text: Oorah.  104. So Long stomps forward in his exoskeleton, pulls down his skull-shaped ballistic face mask. KP’s not nearly as gung

dialogues.speaker: DEEPER IN THE LAB
dialogues.text: Bloodshot hides. Suddenly -- he hears an high-pitched whi WHAM -- Bloodshot gets HAMMERED by So Long’s sound cannon The big man STOMPS forward through the smoke -- looking l a mechanical monster from hell.

dialogues.speaker: SO LONG
dialogues.text: Ready to end this dance? The sound cannon WHINES -- then fires again -- BASHING Bloodshot against the wall. Just as he lifts his head -- KP steps in and fires a bioweapon capsule -- it misses -- -- and the capsule hits a WALL, eating through it like ac

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: You don’t have to do this...

dialogues.speaker: KP
dialogues.text: I’m doing my job.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Is it your job to murder innocents? Like my wife? This is what’s been weighing on KP’s conscience... Bloodshot tries to crawl away... So Long stalks after him

dialogues.speaker: SO LONG
dialogues.text: Know what’s funny? All you cared about was getting the guy who killed your old lady... Sound cannon FIRES again -- Bloodshot ducks -- BLAST take out the wall -- revealing an aquatic training room. SO LONG (CONT’D) And now she’s got to die. Might as well have killed her yourself. To punctuate his remark, So Long recharges his sonic gun. As it WHINES, Bloodshot tries to find cover in the --  105.

dialogues.speaker: AQUATIC TRAINING ROOM
dialogues.text: So Long's right behind him -- Bloodshot crawls to the edg the pool... can’t go any further, trapped. So he PUNCHES the red switch on So Long’s belt.

dialogues.speaker: SO LONG
dialogues.text: (laughing) You broke the emergency release? Why would I ever want to take this off? Raises his foot to SQUASH Bloodshot’s head -- SO LONG (CONT’D) I can’t crush your skull without it --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you can’t swim with it -- Bloodshot PUSHES So Long into the massive pool. At the la moment, just before he’s underwater, So Long reaches out PULLS Bloodshot in with him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPLASH -- The two men SINK to the bottom... But it’s clea for So Long -- the exoskeleton is drowning him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Long and Bloodshot wrestle, So Long trying to keep his opponent underwater with him, but Bloodshot won’t drown. So Long SCREAMS underwater with his last breath, a final bubble rolling out of his open mouth... And Bloodshot flips the bird at him in farewell. Breaking free, Bloodshot returns to the surface --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and climbs out, spewing water from his mouth, just as Tibbs steps in, noticing So Long in the pool --

dialogues.speaker: TIBBS
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. Like an animal, Tibbs turns on Bloodshot -- beating him - Just as he’s about to deliver the death blow -- KP interv and GRABS his hand --

dialogues.speaker: KP
dialogues.text: We're not murderers.  106. Tibbs SWINGS at KP -- CRACK -- she goes down HARD. He SWI again -- but she sprays a neurotoxin in his face first -- Tibbs drops, paralyzed. MOMENTS LATER: Bloodshot helps KP escape the fire... she’ hurting badly.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Get out of here. There’s a crazy Russian outside, he’ll take care of you. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: KP
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. For what we did to you.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: It was Harting -- he used us both.

dialogues.speaker: KP
dialogues.text: He’1l use your wife to stop you.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: That’s what he always does. But it won’t work this time. He kicks open the stairwell door and leads KP inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harting watches on monitors -- chaos everywhere -- but he gets an idea. He reaches over and grabs one of the small metal DEVICES brought in earlier.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Scuttle the facility and ready the chopper. Time to uproot and start fresh in Nevada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An explosion spouts fire from a pair of windows. In the distance: sirens.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: TECHS flee the smoke-filled building, cradling Rising Spi technology as sirens blare from the facility. Another TECH in a lab coat and breathing mask stands at t back of an open van --

dialogues.speaker: GAS MASK TECH
dialogues.text: Stow your tech here! Hurry! The TECHS all drop off their hardware in the van --  107. When the last one runs off... And Gas Mask Tech pulls off gas mask to reveal it’s KRIEGER. Krieger smiles at the van full of priceless RST property.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina jumps as something BASHES the door to her cell. WHUM WHUMP. And then it comes crashing open. Gina coils, ready to defend herself, when -- Bloodshot steps in.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Ray! (then, hesitant) Is it you? He notices his alabaster flesh, his circular scar, traces black nanite blood on his body like remnants of a tattoo.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I’m not sure. Gina goes to him, both drawn to the man she loved, and a fearful of what he’s become. She’s seen it firsthand now.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: I saw what they did to you. What they've been doing... I had no idea...

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I know. (then) You shouldn't even be here. Let’s fix that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elevator opens its doors. Bloodshot gets Gina inside a starts to step in, but pauses at the threshold. BLOODSHOT’S POV: In one corner of his vision, a security camera viewpoint, showing Harting in a server room. An overlay graphic indicates what Harting is doing -- He's downloading the Bloodshot program data. 20%... 25%..

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Ray? What is it?  108. Bloodshot remains at the threshold. Not stepping in.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I have a ride waiting for you downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: What about us? Beat. Bloodshot eventually shakes his head ‘no.’

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I can’t remember us. I don’t even remember our wedding night.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Then we have another one. What does it matter? Ray, I don’t love you for what you remember, I love you for who you are.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Gina, they will keep coming at me until I’m dead, or I stop them. I may be dead either way. But I have one chance to stop Harting. She knows what he’s saying. A kind of goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Ray. Please...

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: What would he do? Ray. The man you married. It’s a direct question, and the answer pains Gina. But sh won't lie to him.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: He would stop the bad guys, once and for all. And then he’d come back to me.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Because you did it once already. The building rumbles again -- some interior explosion fro deep within its walls. Their time is running out. He pulls her close and kisses her. When he steps back, th elevator doors close between them. As they close --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I love you.  109.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Kick his ass for me. With that, Bloodshot is off and running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot KICKS open the door, stepping to the center of room stacked with computer towers. At one station, the da download is still running: 85%... 90%...
