From behind, Harting AMBUSHES Bloodshot -- gets Bloodshot a choke-hold with his cyber-arm. Bloodshot struggles to break free... His face turning red

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: I put years of work into you. You’re the best idea I’ve ever had. Do you understand how this makes me feel? Bloodshot then BREAKS HIS OWN ARM at the elbow so it can reach backward and grab hold of Harting’s head --

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I was a soldier, you made me a killer!

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: What's the difference? Bloodshot finally kicks Harting back into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harting stands, backs up, looking for a way out, for something to use on Bloodshot here -- He finds the Japanese SHORT SWORD on a table. Picks it up Bloodshot steps in. A silhouette against the lights from outside. His eyes shine red, his teeth white. For one fra of the movie he is a comic book panel.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: That knife can’t stop me, doc. Harting pulls out the DEVICE from R&D and thumbs a power button on its top.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: It can with this.  110. Harting throws the device -- Bloodshot takes a step back, then as it WINKS like a grenade he decides to grab it and throw it back out the door when -- The device DETONATES -- but instead of an explosion a blu sphere of ENERGY pulses out from the device in a silent balloon of light -- -- all the robotics and computers in a six-foot radius ar Bloodshot instantly POWER DOWN -- And Bloodshot falls heavily to the floor. The RED CIRCLE in his chest throbs red, and then fizzles dull gray. Along with the rest of his skin. Harting steps close, looming over Bloodshot.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Martin Axe had the right idea. He just went too big. All it takes to drop you is one contained electro-magnetic pulse. Bloodshot tries to move, but every motion is painful.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The nanites have helped you with everything. Without them, you’re just Ray Garrison. And Ray Garrison is dead. Bloodshot reaches out for Harting. Harting remains an inch beyond reach. Staring down at him

dialogues.speaker: HARTING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I had such hopes for us. (then) This hurts me more than it does you, believe me. Harting thrusts the blade into Bloodshot’s chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harting walks away, leaving Bloodshot on the floor, bleed out black blood like an oil spill. The red emergency lights clack on. Sirens blare. The faci is prepping for self-destruct. Bloodshot stares at the ceiling with red eyes. The black nanite-filled blood seeps out... Bloodshot sees a WORK LIGHT still on, a dozen feet away.  111. With every last ounce of strength, in his dying breaths, crawls to the power cable strewn on the floor. He then pulls out the sword from his chest. That starts another stream of black blood onto the floor. Bloodshot’s final action: He slams the blade down on the power cable, severing it. He then falls over, dead. Nothing left in him. The inert nanite blood pools, creeping toward -- The LIVE WIRE. And when the black fluid touches it... A ripple of ELECTRICITY SNAKES THROUGH the blood. For a moment it’s like a lightning storm inside a black cloud. And then, just like that -- The blood stops seeping out. It REVERSES DIRECTION. BLOODSHOT’S DEAD EYES flutter, then blink. BLOODSHOT’S POV: Self-diagnostic data scrolls past his fi of view along with the big words: “REBOOT SEQUENCE.” Suddenly he takes a big breath. Sits up. Overhead, the sound of a helicopter powering up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harting hurries for the chopper, the PILOT gesturing for when -- SLAM -- stairwell door flies open behind Harting. It’s Bloodshot. He THROWS Harting’s sword, hard as he can Harting dodges it. Faces Bloodshot defiantly:

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: You missed.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Wasn’t aiming for you. Harting looks back -- the Pilot is now crumpled over the yoke, the sword buried in his back. Harting moves for Bloodshot now. Harting hits hard with h cyber-arm, but Bloodshot takes the punch -- Every time it looks like his jaw is broken, it immediatel resets. Even the bruising disappears.  112. But it just makes Harting more furious, and he SLAMS Bloodshot down, this time making him spit up black blood.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: I’ve killed you before.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I’ve learned a thing or two since then. The black blood spilling from Bloodshot’s wound suddenly begins to rise like a tendril -- As if the nanite-controlled plasma were its own creature -- and it STRIKES into Harting’s cyber-arm, pulsing with synaptic bio-electric current -- The sparks SHORT-CIRCUIT that arm, seizing it up -- And now Harting’s arm is LOCKED IN PLACE, firmly gripping Bloodshot’s arm. The two men are as good as handcuffed. The battle has swayed in Bloodshot’s favor. Harting can’t keep up with Bloodshot’s relentless assault, especially w just one free arm. With every strike, Bloodshot pushes Harting to the edge o the roof. Harting knows he’s losing. Starts to get desper

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Wait! I can give you what you want.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: Your memories. Every night with your wife. Every friend you ever had. I can give you your life back. It weighs on Bloodshot’s heart, this offer. Ten minutes a it’s all he would have wanted. But now...

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I don’t need it anymore. Bloodshot drags them both to the lip of the roof, teeteri dozen stories from the ground. The building burns. Hartin terrified, in disbelief at what is about to happen.

dialogues.speaker: HARTING
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Bloodshot uses Harting’s own words back at him:  113.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Stepping off the ledge. With that, Bloodshot hurls himself and Harting off the ro WIDE ANGLE: The two figures fall 200 feet -- but only one voice SCREAMS all the way down: Harting. The ground rushe for them, and then:

dialogues.speaker: BLACKNESS
dialogues.text: And we just sit there for a beat. After what feels like a eternity... a red light begins to flash, revealing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodshot wakes with a start -- back in a hospital gown. Krieger is right there, waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: Wait, that worked? That worked! I must write this down.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Hell of a hangover. Krieger smiles, happy with his science work.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: Good. Next question. What do you remember? A beat. Bloodshot looks around, takes in the room. It’s n much more than a warehouse, stocked with high-tech gadget and other junk MacGuyvered into useful tools. And then standing farther back is KP. Watching curiously.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Enough. And you can call me Ray. He slowly gets out of the bed. Rolls his shoulders. And n the crazy machinery that brought him back. BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) How permanent is this?

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: Ehh, a month? A week? It is a mystery.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: Great, just great. Love specific answers. (then) And Harting?  114.

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: Dead. But he is easily replaced. RST is a giant monster. You just hacked off one finger, really. Start looking over your shoulder, friend, they will be after you soon as they find out you are alive. Bloodshot nods. Blinks. The next question is the hardest:

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: What about Gina?

dialogues.speaker: KRIEGER
dialogues.text: Back home. Safe and sound. For now. Like with you, is just a matter of time. Bloodshot lets out a breath. Looks around. Goes to KP.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: KP. Good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: KP
dialogues.text: Good to see you. Again. Finally I don’t have to pretend this is your first rodeo. So... What happens now?

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: I didn’t think I’d live to see this far.

dialogues.speaker: KP
dialogues.text: (beat) So I guess you’re going back to your wife? Bloodshot wants that more than anything. But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina walks down a cobblestone alley, carrying groceries.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Not yet... She steps into the parking courtyard and stops, surprised HER PICKUP is fully repaired and washed. The collision wi So Long is now hardly a dent on the front grill. Gina is confused and shocked, but then she realizes. Grin Her husband is still out there.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I still have work to do. SMASH TO BLACK.  115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kozol walks through his lavish living room, on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: KOZOL
dialogues.text: Well keep at it. Men like him just don’t vanish into thin air. He’s out-- (checks phone) Hello? A distant WHUMP from somewhere elsewhere in the building. Kozol points a remote at a large FLATSCREEN: Revealing a block of SECURITY CAMERAS all showing static. Now, sounds of muffled GUNFIRE outside the penthouse. Boo thumping on the roof above Kozol. Kozol goes to a table and picks up a handgun. Chambers a round in the barrel. Above him, a BODY is thrown through the skylight -- CRASHING to the floor in a bloody heap. In all black, wea a security officer's cap. Kozol sees the casualty and points the gun at the ceiling tracking sounds on the roof. He turns his back on the guard’s body... and misses the s of the man RISING from the floor, tossing off the cap... It’s BLOODSHOT. Kozol turns around in time to see Bloodshot crack his nec back into place, and then he pulls out a LARGER HANDGUN t point it at Kozol... Kozol drops his weapon, and raises his hands in surrender The two stand a half dozen paces away. Kozol smiles, like giving up is relaxing. Bloodshot didn’t expect this.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: You could've fought back a little.

dialogues.speaker: KOZOL
dialogues.text: You could’ve used the front door.  116.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: But it’s a nice day out. (cocks weapon) You know why I’m here, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: KOZOL
dialogues.text: Cleaning up Harting’s mess, no doubt. You believe killing me will put a stop to this whole business.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: KOZOL
dialogues.text: But I know something you don’t. And you'll want to hear it before you pull that trigger.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODSHOT
dialogues.text: That so?

dialogues.speaker: KOZOL
dialogues.text: You are the product of a decade of nanotech research. Billions of dollars were spent, in utter secrecy. No one puts that effort into a weapon unless it’s to defeat an unstoppable enemy. (beat) I’m not the ultimate threat, Garrison. But I can show you who is. Kozol points a remote at a large flatscreen. ON SCREEN: Aerial footage as if from a surveillance drone an A150 plane, over an ocean, near a massive offshore rig The lens zooms, zeroed in on an Asian man we’ve seen before... TOYO HARADA. Harada_is hovering fifty feet off the water, eyes aglow, pointing at the rig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures with his hands, and the massive structure RIS out of the water -- workers JUMPING off to flee -- others hanging on as tethers snap -- The ten-thousand-ton structure keeps rising like an eleva revealing the PUMP that extends to the ocean floor... ZOOMING OUT in time to see Harada gesture, and LAUNCH the entire thing into the stratosphere. ON BLOODSHOT: Gobsmacked. Who the hell can do that? SLAM TO BLACK.
